docs.text: Command - Deploy Service Deploys a docker service using a 'service.json' service specification file. Syntax docker-service-deploy deploy-service --model file.json #!/bin/bash docker-service-deploy deploy-service --model file.json docker-service-deploy deploy-service --model file.json public class Bleh { public string Test1 { get; set; } }
docs.title: Deploy Service

docs.text: Deploys a docker service using a 'service.json' service specification file.
docs.title: Command - Deploy Service

docs.text: docker-service-deploy deploy-service --model file.json #!/bin/bash docker-service-deploy deploy-service --model file.json docker-service-deploy deploy-service --model file.json public class Bleh { public string Test1 { get; set; } }
docs.title: Syntax

docs.text: Command - Expand Service Model Reads a service.json file, expands any environment variables using the specified environment name, and prints the resulting model.
docs.title: Expand Service Model

docs.text: Reads a service.json file, expands any environment variables using the specified environment name, and prints the resulting model.
docs.title: Command - Expand Service Model

docs.text: Command - Test Auth Config Attempts to load auth from the local .docker/config.json file to see if it's accessible.
docs.title: Test Auth Config

docs.text: Attempts to load auth from the local .docker/config.json file to see if it's accessible.
docs.title: Command - Test Auth Config

docs.text: Service Specification A service can be specified using JSON, the format is heavily based on the Docker Compose format, to allow for easy migration between either format. { "environments": { "Development": { "" } }, "sample-api": { "prop": 42 } }
docs.title: Basics
